div.p: Questions about COVID-19 now being answered by Louisiana 211 statewide network. Â Anyone looking for information about the COVID-19 outbreak can simply dial 211 or text the keyword LACOVID to 898-211 for the most current information about the outbreak as it becomes available. Â More info...

div.class: inner col col2 first last id10366329-5404-4c89-9e27-1c4872c3193e
inner col col20 first last id8efb32ef-7b83-4d39-9188-7c7d1b3b56b9
inner col col2 first last idcb21ff9e-0060-4908-8d92-c2a222dfebe3
inner col col24 first last idfefc8038-e760-4243-9024-89637e961228

li.span: The CDC is responding to an outbreak of a respiratory disease caused by a novel (new) coronavirus that was first detected in China.
Symptoms are similar to the flu including fever, cough, and difficulty breathing or shortness of breath.Â

strong.span: Most cases are mild and there is a low mortality rate.Â

li.span: Click here for frequently asked questions.Â

span.strong: For more information on the virus visit the CDC Website or call the COVID19 General Information Line at 1-855-523-2652 (
Â 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM Monday through Friday).Â

div.class: inner col col15 first last id2f6c821f-ab4e-40f8-bead-3ae86e4922c2
inner col col5 first last id8a69f01b-39d2-4733-9b2b-0a3b4a4f0b9a
inner col col24 first last ida0b3e5fc-0c20-4106-a745-b3b9f36e81c6
inner col col24 first last id58d10e58-6184-49f0-872d-c3dcac638af7

strong.span: * There is no specific antiviral treatment recommended for COVID-19 (Novel Coronavirus).*

li.span: People who think they may have been exposed to the virus should contact their healthcare provider immediately.
If you have trouble breathing, please call 9-1-1!Â

div.class: inner col col13 first last iddd072718-e973-484d-a4a2-baf8269f72aa

br.span: People can help protect themselves from this respiratory illness with everyday preventive actions.Â

li.span: Avoid close contact with people who are sick.Â
Wash your hands for 20 seconds with soap and water.
Use at least 60% alcohol based handsanitizer.Â
Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, then throw the tissue in the trash.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces using a regular household cleaning spray or wipe.Â
